boardgame.name: Haru Ichiban
春风
boardgame.description: In Haru Ichiban, or _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The Wind of Spring_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, two apprentice gardeners compete to use this wind to their advantage to create harmonious patterns of their blossoms upon the lilypads._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each gardener has eight flower buds numbered 1-8, with three of those buds being in hand at the start of a round. Sixteen lilypads are placed in the 5x5 pond, with one of them turned to its dark side._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each gardener simultaneously chooses a reveals a bud, with the player with the lower number becoming the Little Gardener and the other becoming the Grand Gardener. In order:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Little Gardener places one of his colored blossoms on the dark lilypad._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Grand Gardener places one of his colored blossoms on the lilypad of his choice._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Little Gardener moves one lilypad to an adjacent space, possibly moving other lilypads at the same time._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; The Grand Gardener flips one unoccupied lilypad to its dark side._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Each gardener takes a new bud._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;As soon as a gardener creates a specific pattern with blossoms of his color, he scores points: 1 point for a 2x2 square, 2 points for a horizontal or vertical row of four blossoms, 3 points for a diagonal row of four blossoms, and 5 points for a row of five blossoms. If the gardener has fewer than five points, the gardeners reset the board and start a new round with three buds of their eight; if the gardener has five or more points, the game ends and he wins!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

The game is in perfect condition. Only unwrapped and marveled at. Most beautiful game I have ever owned. Don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t dare to play with it :)
The Game was played one or two times and has no marks of use.

This is one of only 300 (!!) beautiful, limited 1st edition of the game in wood. SIGNED by the designer, Bruno Cathala (signature is on the removable tray that holds the peices). Condition is like new, besides a very thin trace/line on one half of the board (see pictures), made by the removable tray that holds the peices when folded - design flaw, not misuse.
